title: AI reshaping commerce industry from assisted buying to autonomous transactions: Report
description: Artificial Intelligence is starting to reshape the commerce sector, with the shift moving beyond recommendations and customer support to AI agents that can independently complete purchases on behalf of consumers and businesses, highlighted a report by Global Payments Inc., which provides technology and services for processing payments.

title: Indian-origin techie who helped Apple fight terrorism quits to build startup
description: Kalyani Ramadurgam studied computer science with a specialisation in artificial intelligence and machine learning.
content: During her time at Apple, Ramadurgam noticed a gap between the company’s advanced technology and the way compliance processes were handled. Despite Apple’s sophistication, many systems were slow, heavily manual, and required large teams to review ext... [1213 chars]

title: Coforge shares in focus on announcing $2.35 billion acquisition of AI firm Encora
description: Coforge is set to be in focus after announcing a $2.35 billion acquisition of AI firm Encora to boost its artificial intelligence capabilities and expand its global reach. The deal, which aims to generate $2 billion in annual revenues by March 2027, marks a significant international expansion for the IT services provider.

title: Coforge Shares In Focus On Mega $2.35 Billion Encora Acquisition Plan
description: Coforge Ltd. shares are set to be in focus on Monday after the mid-tier IT services company announced its largest-ever acquisition — the purchase of US-based artificial intelligence and digital engineering firm Encora for an enterprise value of $2.35 billion, or around Rs 21,138 crore.

title: Institutes of higher learning expand industry partnerships to prepare students for tech-driven media landscape
description: Schools are partnering up to 50 per cent more organisations than before to help them navigate new trends brought on by technology and artificial intelligence.
content:
SINGAPORE: For the first time at Temasek Polytechnic, first-year students can take a course next year that combines artificial intelligence and data analytics.

title: Fabless chip companies eye surveillance market play via edge-AI silicon
description: Indian startups are designing advanced chips for video surveillance. These chips will process artificial intelligence locally on devices. This focus on edge AI is a first step towards a wider automation vision. Companies like Netrasemi, BigEndian, and Sensesemi are developing specialized silicon. Their goal is to create secure, domestically designed surveillance systems for India by 2030.
content:

title: 2025: The Turning Point in India's Technological Self-Determination
description: The year 2025 marked a defining inflection point in India’s scientific and technological journey, as the nation emerged with renewed confidence and global stature across frontier domains. It signals a fundamental reorientation in India’s relationship with technology itself. From artificial intelligence and semiconductors to space exploration, nuclear energy and critical minerals, India demonstrated that it is no longer merely adopting global technologies but shaping them. For the first time in India’s independent history, technological self-determination is not a dream but […]
